byline.contributor: Justin Gillis reported from Le Bourget, and Chris Buckley from Beijing.
byline.original: By JUSTIN GILLIS and CHRIS BUCKLEY

abstract: Report made public at Paris climate talks shows greenhouse gas emissions rose only incrementally in 2014 and may decline slightly in 2015, despite growth of global economy; some suggest global emissions have peaked, while others say rebounding Chinese economy and increase in India's coal burning will reverse trend.
lead_paragraph: Industrial emissions of greenhouse gases rose just slightly last year and seem to be on the decline in 2015, though initiatives in India and China could upset that.

headline.main: Period of Soaring Emissions May Be Ending, New Data Suggest
headline.print_headline: Period of Soaring Emissions May Be Ending, New Data Suggest

snippet: Industrial emissions of greenhouse gases rose just slightly last year and seem to be on the decline in 2015, though initiatives in India and China could upset that.

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
